t: Isaiah 10
Woe*pn to those who make unjust laws, to*ld those who issue oppressive decrees,
to*ln deprive the poor of their rights and*ld withhold justice from the oppressed of my people, making*ln widows their prey and*ld robbing the fatherless.
What*ln will you do on the day of reckoning, when*ld disaster comes from afar? To*ln whom will you run for help? Where*ld will you leave your riches?
Nothing*ln will remain but to cringe among the captives or*ld fall among the slain. Yet*pn for all this, his anger is not turned away, his*ld hand is still upraised.
God’s Judgment on Assyria
“Woe*pn to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in*ld whose hand is the club of my wrath!
I*ln send him against a godless nation, I*ld dispatch him against a people who anger me, to*ln seize loot and snatch plunder, and*ld to trample them down like mud in the streets.
But*ln this is not what he intends, this*ld is not what he has in mind; his*ln purpose is to destroy, to*ld put an end to many nations.
‘Are*ln not my commanders all kings?’ he says.
‘Has*ld not Kalno fared like Carchemish? Is*ln not Hamath like Arpad, and*ld Samaria like Damascus?
As*ln my hand seized the kingdoms of the idols, kingdoms*ld whose images excelled those of Jerusalem and Samaria—
shall*ln I not deal with Jerusalem and her images as*ld I dealt with Samaria and her idols?’ ”
When*p the Lord has finished all his work against Mount Zion and Jerusalem, he will say, “I will punish the king of Assyria for the willful pride of his heart and the haughty look in his eyes.

For he says: “ ‘By*pn the strength of my hand I have done this, and*ld by my wisdom, because I have understanding. I*ln removed the boundaries of nations, I*ld plundered their treasures; like*ld a mighty one I subdued their kings.

As*ln one reaches into a nest, so*ld my hand reached for the wealth of the nations; as*ln people gather abandoned eggs, so*ld I gathered all the countries; not*ln one flapped a wing, or*ld opened its mouth to chirp.’ ”

Does*pn the ax raise itself above the person who swings it, or*ld the saw boast against the one who uses it? As*ln if a rod were to wield the person who lifts it up, or*ld a club brandish the one who is not wood!
Therefore,*ln the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, will*ld send a wasting disease upon his sturdy warriors; under*ln his pomp a fire will be kindled like*ld a blazing flame.
The*ln Light of Israel will become a fire, their*ld Holy One a flame; in*ln a single day it will burn and consume his*ld thorns and his briers.
The*ln splendor of his forests and fertile fields it*ld will completely destroy, as*ld when a sick person wastes away.
And*ln the remaining trees of his forests will be so few that*ld a child could write them down.
The Remnant of Israel
In*pn that day the remnant of Israel, the*ld survivors of Jacob, will*ln no longer rely on him who*ld struck them down but*ln will truly rely on the Lord,*s the*ld Holy One of Israel.
A*ln remnant will return, a remnant of Jacob will*ld return to the Mighty God.
Though*ln your people be like the sand by the sea, Israel, only*ld a remnant will return. Destruction*ln has been decreed, overwhelming*ld and righteous.
The*ln Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, will carry out the*ld destruction decreed upon the whole land.

Therefore*p this is what the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, says: “My*pn people who live in Zion, do*ld not be afraid of the Assyrians, who*ln beat you with a rod and*ld lift up a club against you, as Egypt did.
Very*ln soon my anger against you will end and*ld my wrath will be directed to their destruction.”
The*pn Lord*s Almighty will lash them with a whip, as*ld when he struck down Midian at the rock of Oreb; and*ln he will raise his staff over the waters, as*ld he did in Egypt.
In*ln that day their burden will be lifted from your shoulders, their*ld yoke from your neck; the*ln yoke will be broken because*ld you have grown so fat.
They*pn enter Aiath; they*ld pass through Migron; they*ld store supplies at Mikmash.
They*ln go over the pass, and say, “We*ld will camp overnight at Geba.” Ramah*ln trembles; Gibeah*ld of Saul flees.
Cry*ln out, Daughter Gallim! Listen,*ld Laishah! Poor*ld Anathoth!
Madmenah*ln is in flight; the*ld people of Gebim take cover.
This*ln day they will halt at Nob; they*ld will shake their fist at*ln the mount of Daughter Zion, at*ld the hill of Jerusalem.
See,*pn the Lord, the Lord*s Almighty, will*ld lop off the boughs with great power. The*ln lofty trees will be felled, the*ld tall ones will be brought low.
He*ln will cut down the forest thickets with an ax; Lebanon*ld will fall before the Mighty One.
